title: Expert Course on Hypermedia Design and Evaluation for Remote Language Education Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of fundamental language education concepts (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension, expression) and hypermedia principles, intermediate-level digital tool application skills
context.additional_context: Strengthening hypermedia design competencies specialized for language education—such as pronunciation training, contextual understanding, and cultural context incorporation—by creating language education content using learners’ personal digital devices (tablets/smartphones).

learning_goals: When designing educational hypermedia, learners use an evaluation tool applying six criteria (Affective/Technical/Usability/Scenario/Multimedia/Educational Elements) to assess three language learning hypermedia samples, complete a 5-point scale evaluation table per criterion, and submit a report achieving over 80% total score.
Integrate visual elements (photography, typography, semantic analysis) into multimedia document design for language learning to maximize vocabulary and grammar learning effectiveness.
Develop a hypermedia prototype for language learning that considers learner interactivity (reading/writing feedback, pronunciation assessment) in an online asynchronous environment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
